name: encounter_id
description: The "encounter_id" field uniquely identifies an encounter within a healthcare system. It is crucial for linking related data across different systems and ensuring continuity of care. This identifier is typically assigned by the healthcare provider and is used in various clinical, administrative, and billing processes. It is essential for tracking patient interactions and managing healthcare workflows.

name: lastupdated
description: The "lastupdated" field indicates the most recent date and time when the encounter record was modified. This timestamp is vital for data integrity and version control, ensuring that healthcare providers have access to the latest information. It supports audit trails and helps in maintaining accurate and up-to-date patient records.

name: hl7_message_date_time
description: The "hl7_message_date_time" field captures the date and time when the HL7 message related to the encounter was generated. This information is crucial for message tracking, ensuring timely communication between systems, and maintaining synchronization of patient data across different healthcare applications.

name: hl7_message_date_time_UTC
description: The "hl7_message_date_time_UTC" field represents the HL7 message timestamp in Coordinated Universal Time (UTC). This standardization is essential for interoperability, allowing systems in different time zones to accurately interpret and process the message timing, thus ensuring consistent data exchange.

name: hl7_message_control_id
description: The "hl7_message_control_id" field is a unique identifier for an HL7 message, used to track and manage message exchanges between systems. It ensures message integrity and helps in identifying and resolving issues related to message delivery and processing, playing a critical role in healthcare interoperability.

name: meta_latest_source_date_time
description: The "meta_latest_source_date_time" field indicates the most recent date and time when the source data for the encounter was updated. This metadata is important for data provenance, helping to verify the currency and reliability of the information used in clinical decision-making and reporting.

name: intermediate_snapshot_creation_date_time
description: The "intermediate_snapshot_creation_date_time" field records the date and time when an intermediate snapshot of the encounter data was created. This snapshot is used for data backup, recovery, and analysis, ensuring that historical data states can be reviewed and audited as needed.

name: final_fhir_write_date_time
description: The "final_fhir_write_date_time" field captures the date and time when the encounter data was last written to the FHIR server. This timestamp is crucial for ensuring that the most recent data is available for clinical use and that updates are accurately reflected in the FHIR repository.

name: final_fhir_commit_date_time
description: The "final_fhir_commit_date_time" field represents the date and time when the encounter data was committed to the FHIR server. This ensures data consistency and integrity, confirming that the data is finalized and available for use in clinical and administrative processes.

name: encounter_version_id
description: The "encounter_version_id" field identifies the version of the encounter record, supporting version control and data management. It is essential for tracking changes over time, ensuring that healthcare providers can access the correct version of the encounter data for clinical decision-making and reporting.

name: version_id_fingerprint
description: The 'version_id_fingerprint' field is used to uniquely identify a specific version of the FHIR resource. It ensures data integrity and version control, allowing systems to track changes and updates to the resource over time. This field is crucial for maintaining accurate and consistent records in healthcare systems, especially in environments where data is frequently updated or modified.

name: consent_coid
description: The 'consent_coid' field represents a unique identifier for a patient's consent document. It is essential for managing patient consent preferences, ensuring that healthcare providers comply with legal and ethical standards regarding patient data usage. This field is critical for maintaining patient autonomy and privacy, as it directly relates to the permissions granted by the patient for data sharing and treatment.

name: meta_action_code
description: The 'meta_action_code' field indicates the type of action performed on the FHIR resource, such as creation, update, or deletion. It is vital for audit trails and tracking changes within healthcare systems, ensuring transparency and accountability in data management. This field helps in understanding the lifecycle of a resource and is crucial for maintaining accurate and up-to-date patient records.

name: hl7_v2_source_interface
description: The 'hl7_v2_source_interface' field identifies the source interface from which the HL7 v2 message originated. It is important for interoperability and data exchange between different healthcare systems, ensuring that data is accurately transmitted and received. This field helps in tracing the origin of data and is crucial for troubleshooting and maintaining data integrity across systems.

name: patient_account_num
description: The 'patient_account_num' field is a unique identifier assigned to a patient's account within a healthcare facility. It is used for billing, administrative, and clinical purposes, ensuring that all patient-related activities are accurately recorded and tracked. This field is essential for managing patient accounts and is considered sensitive information, as it can be used to access patient records and financial data.

name: patient_primary_id
description: The 'patient_primary_id' field serves as the primary identifier for a patient within a healthcare system. It is crucial for linking all patient-related data, ensuring that healthcare providers have a complete and accurate view of the patient's medical history. This field is a key component of patient identity management and is considered sensitive information, as it can be used to access a patient's medical records.

name: network_mnemonic
description: The 'network_mnemonic' field represents a shorthand or code used to identify a specific healthcare network. It is used for routing and managing data within and across healthcare systems, ensuring that information is directed to the correct network. This field is important for interoperability and efficient data exchange, but it does not contain patient-specific information.

name: medical_record_num
description: The 'medical_record_num' field is a unique identifier assigned to a patient's medical record. It is used to organize and access a patient's medical history, ensuring that healthcare providers have the necessary information for diagnosis and treatment. This field is a critical component of patient care and is considered sensitive information, as it can be used to access detailed medical records.

name: coid
description: The 'coid' field represents a unique identifier for a specific consent or contract within a healthcare system. It is used to manage and track patient consents, ensuring compliance with legal and ethical standards. This field is important for maintaining patient privacy and autonomy, as it relates to the permissions granted by the patient for data sharing and treatment.

name: facility_mnemonic
description: The 'facility_mnemonic' field is a shorthand or code used to identify a specific healthcare facility. It is used for routing and managing data within and across healthcare systems, ensuring that information is directed to the correct facility. This field is important for interoperability and efficient data exchange, but it does not contain patient-specific information.

name: fhir_visit_status
description: The "fhir_visit_status" field in a FHIR Encounter resource indicates the current status of the encounter, such as planned, in-progress, or completed. It is crucial for tracking the encounter's lifecycle and managing workflows. This field helps in understanding the patient's current interaction with the healthcare system and is essential for operational and clinical decision-making.

name: fhir_patient_class_code
description: The "fhir_patient_class_code" field represents the classification of the patient during the encounter, such as inpatient, outpatient, or emergency. It is used to categorize the type of care provided and impacts billing, resource allocation, and care planning. This classification is vital for understanding the context of the encounter and ensuring appropriate care delivery.

name: fhir_patient_class_display
description: The "fhir_patient_class_display" field provides a human-readable description of the patient class code, offering clarity and context for healthcare providers and administrative staff. It aids in the interpretation of the patient class, facilitating communication and understanding across different systems and stakeholders involved in patient care.

name: patient_type
description: The "patient_type" field categorizes the patient based on specific criteria, such as new or returning patient, which can influence care pathways, resource allocation, and billing processes. Understanding the patient type is essential for tailoring healthcare services to meet individual needs and ensuring efficient healthcare delivery.

name: admission_type
description: The "admission_type" field specifies the nature of the patient's admission, such as elective, emergency, or urgent. This information is critical for prioritizing care, managing hospital resources, and determining the urgency of medical interventions. It also plays a role in billing and reimbursement processes.

name: patient_class_code
description: The "patient_class_code" field identifies the category of the patient during the encounter, such as inpatient, outpatient, or emergency. It is used for classifying the type of care provided and affects billing, resource allocation, and care planning. This classification is crucial for understanding the context of the encounter and ensuring appropriate care delivery.

name: account_status_code
description: The "account_status_code" field indicates the current status of the patient's account, such as active, closed, or delinquent. It is important for financial management, billing, and ensuring that the patient's financial obligations are met. This field helps in tracking the financial aspects of the patient's encounter and managing revenue cycles.

name: vip_indicator_code
description: The "vip_indicator_code" field identifies whether the patient is considered a VIP (Very Important Person) within the healthcare setting. This designation may affect the level of service provided, privacy considerations, and resource allocation. It is important for managing patient expectations and ensuring appropriate care delivery.

name: financial_class_code
description: The "financial_class_code" field categorizes the patient's financial responsibility, such as self-pay, insured, or government-sponsored. It is crucial for billing, reimbursement, and financial planning. Understanding the financial class helps in managing the financial aspects of patient care and ensuring accurate billing processes.

name: mode_of_arrival_code
description: The "mode_of_arrival_code" field specifies how the patient arrived at the healthcare facility, such as by ambulance, walk-in, or referral. This information is important for understanding the context of the encounter, managing resources, and planning care. It can also impact the urgency and type of care provided.

name: accommodation_code
description: The "accommodation_code" field in a FHIR Encounter resource represents the specific type of accommodation provided to the patient during the encounter. It is used to categorize the patient's room or bed type, such as private, semi-private, or ward. This information is important for billing, resource allocation, and patient management. It helps in determining the cost of the encounter and ensuring appropriate resource utilization.

name: accommodation_code_category
description: The "accommodation_code_category" field categorizes the type of accommodation provided during a patient's encounter. It provides a broader classification than the specific accommodation code, helping in grouping similar types of accommodations for analysis and reporting. This field is useful for operational management and financial analysis, ensuring that accommodations are appropriately categorized for billing and resource planning.

name: hospital_service_type_code
description: The "hospital_service_type_code" field identifies the specific type of service provided during the encounter, such as surgical, medical, or pediatric services. This code is crucial for billing, resource allocation, and clinical documentation. It helps in understanding the nature of the services rendered and is used for reporting and analysis of hospital services.

name: hospital_service_type_text
description: The "hospital_service_type_text" field provides a textual description of the type of service provided during the encounter. It complements the hospital service type code by offering a human-readable explanation of the service. This field is useful for clinical documentation, patient communication, and ensuring clarity in the description of services rendered.

name: admit_source_code
description: The "admit_source_code" field indicates the source from which the patient was admitted to the healthcare facility, such as a physician referral, emergency room, or transfer from another facility. This information is important for understanding patient flow, resource allocation, and for certain billing processes. It helps in analyzing admission patterns and planning for resource needs.

name: discharge_disposition
description: The "discharge_disposition" field describes the patient's status and destination upon discharge from the encounter, such as home, transferred to another facility, or deceased. It includes a code and a display text for clarity. This information is critical for care continuity, discharge planning, and billing. It helps in understanding patient outcomes and planning post-discharge care.

name: patient_id
description: The "patient_id" field uniquely identifies the patient involved in the encounter. It is a critical element for linking the encounter to the patient's medical record and ensuring accurate patient identification. This field is essential for clinical documentation, billing, and continuity of care. It must be handled with care to protect patient privacy and confidentiality.

name: appointment_id
description: The "appointment_id" field uniquely identifies the appointment associated with the encounter. It links the encounter to the scheduling system, facilitating appointment management and tracking. This field is important for operational efficiency, ensuring that encounters are correctly associated with scheduled appointments, and for analyzing appointment adherence and resource utilization.

name: account_id
description: The "account_id" field uniquely identifies the financial account associated with the encounter. It is used for billing and financial management, linking the encounter to the patient's financial records. This field is crucial for ensuring accurate billing, payment processing, and financial reporting. It must be managed carefully to protect financial information.

name: deceased_date_time
description: The "deceased_date_time" field records the date and time of the patient's death, if applicable, during the encounter. This information is vital for clinical documentation, legal reporting, and care planning. It is used to update the patient's medical record and inform care teams and family members. Accurate recording is essential for data integrity and legal compliance.

name: admission_date
description: The "admission_date" field in a FHIR Encounter resource represents the date and time when the patient was officially admitted to the healthcare facility. It is crucial for determining the start of the encounter and is used for clinical documentation, billing, and operational purposes. Accurate admission dates are essential for data quality and clinical decision-making.

name: discharge_date
description: The "discharge_date" field in a FHIR Encounter resource represents the date and time when the patient was officially discharged from the encounter. It marks the end of the encounter and is crucial for billing, clinical documentation, and quality improvement. The discharge_date is closely related to the period element of the Encounter resource.

name: is_valid_date_ind
description: The "is_valid_date_ind" field indicates whether the provided date values in the encounter are valid. This boolean field helps ensure data integrity and accuracy, which is critical for clinical decision-making and operational processes. It does not contain PHI/PII but is important for data validation.

name: alt_admission_date_time
description: The "alt_admission_date_time" field provides an alternative representation of the admission date and time. This may be used for compatibility with different systems or standards. It is important for ensuring accurate and consistent data across systems, especially in interoperability scenarios.

name: hl7_admission_date_time
description: The "hl7_admission_date_time" field represents the admission date and time formatted according to HL7 standards. This ensures interoperability and consistency across healthcare systems that use HL7 messaging. It is crucial for accurate data exchange and integration.

name: alt_discharge_date_time
description: The "alt_discharge_date_time" field provides an alternative representation of the discharge date and time. This may be used for compatibility with different systems or standards. It is important for ensuring accurate and consistent data across systems, especially in interoperability scenarios.

name: hl7_discharge_date_time
description: The "hl7_discharge_date_time" field represents the discharge date and time formatted according to HL7 standards. This ensures interoperability and consistency across healthcare systems that use HL7 messaging. It is crucial for accurate data exchange and integration.

name: reason_for_visit_text
description: The "reason_for_visit_text" field captures the patient's reason for the encounter in a textual format. It is essential for clinical documentation, care planning, and communication among healthcare providers. This field may contain sensitive information related to the patient's health condition.

name: mt_reason_for_visit_code
description: The "mt_reason_for_visit_code" field represents the coded reason for the patient's visit. Using standardized codes facilitates interoperability, data analysis, and reporting. It is crucial for ensuring consistent documentation and communication across healthcare systems.

name: patient_location
description: The "patient_location" field provides details about the patient's location during the encounter. It includes subfields like location_id, mnemonic, and physical_type, which help identify and describe the location. This information is important for operational purposes and care coordination.

fields.name: location_id
fields.description: The "location_id" field uniquely identifies the location where the patient is situated during the encounter. It is crucial for tracking patient movement and ensuring accurate location-based services within healthcare facilities.

fields.name: mnemonic
fields.description: The "mnemonic" field provides a shorthand or code for the location, facilitating quick identification and communication within healthcare systems. It is useful for operational efficiency and location management.

fields.name: physical_type
fields.description: The "physical_type" field describes the type of physical location, such as a room, ward, or department. This information is important for understanding the context of the patient's care environment and for operational planning.

fields.name: edm_arrived_date_time
fields.description: The 'edm_arrived_date_time' field captures the exact date and time when a patient arrives at the emergency department. This timestamp is crucial for tracking the patient's journey and is used for clinical documentation, operational efficiency, and quality improvement. It helps in calculating wait times and assessing the department's responsiveness. PHI/PII: True, HIPAA: True

fields.name: edm_triaged_date_time
fields.description: The 'edm_triaged_date_time' field records the date and time when a patient is triaged in the emergency department. This information is vital for understanding the prioritization of care and the efficiency of the triage process. It aids in clinical decision-making and resource allocation. PHI/PII: True, HIPAA: True

fields.name: edm_departure_date_time
fields.description: The 'edm_departure_date_time' field indicates the date and time when a patient departs from the emergency department. This is essential for calculating the length of stay and for discharge planning. It impacts billing, reimbursement, and quality metrics. PHI/PII: True, HIPAA: True

fields.name: coid
fields.description: The 'coid' field represents a unique identifier for the encounter or visit. It is used to track and manage patient records across different systems and is crucial for interoperability and data exchange. PHI/PII: True, HIPAA: True

fields.name: priority_rank
fields.description: The 'priority_rank' field indicates the urgency level assigned to a patient's case in the emergency department. It helps in triage and resource allocation, ensuring that patients receive timely care based on their clinical needs. PHI/PII: False, HIPAA: False

fields.name: priority_code
fields.description: The 'priority_code' field is a coded representation of the patient's priority level in the emergency department. It standardizes the urgency assessment and facilitates communication among healthcare providers. PHI/PII: False, HIPAA: False

fields.name: priority_text
fields.description: The 'priority_text' field provides a textual description of the patient's priority level in the emergency department. It complements the priority code and aids in understanding the clinical context. PHI/PII: False, HIPAA: False

fields.name: edm_reason_for_visit_code
fields.description: The 'edm_reason_for_visit_code' field captures the coded reason for the patient's visit to the emergency department. It is used for clinical documentation, billing, and statistical analysis. PHI/PII: True, HIPAA: True

fields.name: edm_reason_for_visit_text
fields.description: The 'edm_reason_for_visit_text' field provides a textual description of the reason for the patient's visit to the emergency department. It aids in clinical documentation and understanding the patient's presenting problem. PHI/PII: True, HIPAA: True

fields.name: departure_disposition_code
fields.description: The 'departure_disposition_code' field represents a coded value indicating the patient's status or destination upon leaving the emergency department. It is crucial for discharge planning and continuity of care. PHI/PII: True, HIPAA: True

fields.name: departure_disposition_text
fields.description: The 'departure_disposition_text' field provides a textual description of the patient's status or destination upon leaving the emergency department. It complements the coded disposition and aids in clinical documentation. PHI/PII: True, HIPAA: True

fields.name: departure_disposition_display
fields.description: The 'departure_disposition_display' field offers a user-friendly display of the patient's departure disposition from the emergency department. It enhances understanding and communication among healthcare providers. PHI/PII: True, HIPAA: True

fields.name: departure_condition_code
fields.description: The 'departure_condition_code' field captures a coded value representing the patient's condition at the time of departure from the emergency department. It is used for clinical documentation and quality assessment. PHI/PII: True, HIPAA: True

fields.name: departure_condition_text
fields.description: The 'departure_condition_text' field provides a textual description of the patient's condition at the time of departure from the emergency department. It aids in clinical documentation and understanding the patient's status. PHI/PII: True, HIPAA: True

fields.name: departure_condition_display
fields.description: The 'departure_condition_display' field offers a user-friendly display of the patient's condition at the time of departure from the emergency department. It enhances communication and understanding among healthcare providers. PHI/PII: True, HIPAA: True

fields.name: departure_comments
fields.description: The 'departure_comments' field allows for additional notes or comments regarding the patient's departure from the emergency department. It provides context and details that may not be captured in structured fields. PHI/PII: True, HIPAA: True

fields.name: room_code
fields.description: The 'room_code' field represents a coded identifier for the treatment room where the patient is located in the emergency department. It is used for tracking patient location and resource management. PHI/PII: True, HIPAA: True

fields.name: room_text
fields.description: The 'room_text' field provides a textual description of the treatment room where the patient is located in the emergency department. It aids in understanding the patient's location and care setting. PHI/PII: True, HIPAA: True

fields.name: location_code
fields.description: The 'location_code' field captures a coded identifier for the specific location within the emergency department. It is used for tracking patient movement and resource allocation. PHI/PII: True, HIPAA: True

fields.name: location_text
fields.description: The 'location_text' field provides a textual description of the specific location within the emergency department. It aids in understanding the patient's movement and care setting. PHI/PII: True, HIPAA: True

fields.name: room_code
fields.description: The 'room_code' field represents a coded identifier for a reserved room for the patient in the emergency department. It is used for planning and managing patient flow. PHI/PII: True, HIPAA: True

fields.name: room_text
fields.description: The 'room_text' field provides a textual description of a reserved room for the patient in the emergency department. It aids in understanding the patient's future care setting. PHI/PII: True, HIPAA: True

fields.name: transport_company_code
fields.description: The 'transport_company_code' field captures a coded identifier for the transport company involved in the patient's transfer to or from the emergency department. It is used for logistics and coordination. PHI/PII: False, HIPAA: False

fields.name: transport_company_display
fields.description: The 'transport_company_display' field provides a user-friendly display of the transport company involved in the patient's transfer. It enhances communication and understanding among healthcare providers. PHI/PII: False, HIPAA: False

fields.name: transport_id_code
fields.description: The 'transport_id_code' field captures a coded identifier for the specific transport vehicle or service used for the patient's transfer. It is used for tracking and coordination. PHI/PII: False, HIPAA: False

fields.name: transport_id_display
fields.description: The 'transport_id_display' field provides a user-friendly display of the transport vehicle or service used for the patient's transfer. It aids in communication and understanding among healthcare providers. PHI/PII: False, HIPAA: False

fields.name: transport_call_date_time
fields.description: The 'transport_call_date_time' field records the date and time when the transport service was called for the patient's transfer. It is crucial for logistics, coordination, and ensuring timely patient movement. PHI/PII: True, HIPAA: True

fields.name: mnemonic
fields.description: The 'mnemonic' field represents a shorthand or code used to identify a specific registration query. It is used for quick reference and efficient data entry. PHI/PII: False, HIPAA: False

fields.name: question
fields.description: The 'question' field captures the text of a registration query asked during the patient registration process. It is used for gathering necessary information and ensuring accurate data collection. PHI/PII: False, HIPAA: False

fields.name: response
fields.description: The 'response' field records the patient's answer to a registration query. It is crucial for capturing patient information and ensuring accurate and complete registration data. PHI/PII: True, HIPAA: True

name: insert_timestamp
description: The 'insert_timestamp' field captures the exact date and time when the encounter record was inserted into the system. It is used for auditing, tracking data changes, and ensuring data integrity. PHI/PII: False, HIPAA: False
